sentences.en: ...a series of measures designed to entrench democracy and the rule of law.
sentences.cn: …一系列旨在巩固民主和法制的举措。

sentences.en: A new year looks sure entrench old resentments.
sentences.cn: 新的一年看起来会让不满持续下去.

sentences.en: It would entrench the position of incumbent institutions that are already too large and too diverse.
sentences.cn: 而对那些目前就已太过庞大和庞杂的机构来说,其地位还将借此得到巩固.

sentences.en: They entrench themselves behind undeniable facts.
sentences.cn: 他们在无可否认的事实后面固守著自己.

sentences.en: To hold on stubbornly, as to a position; entrench oneself.
sentences.cn: 固执地坚持立场; 稳固自己的地位.

words.tran_cn: 确立，牢固；用壕沟围住；挖掘

trans.tran_cn: 用壕沟围绕或保护…，牢固地确立…，挖掘壕沟
trans.tran_en: If something such as power, a custom, or an idea is entrenched, it is firmly established, so that it would be difficult to change it

trans.tran_cn: 使根深蒂固， 牢固确立
trans.tran_en: If something such as power, a custom, or an idea is entrenched, it is firmly established, so that it would be difficult to change it
